reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award Fundação de Educação para a Preservação Ambiental e Desenvolvimento Sustentável da Bacia do Rio Paraguaçu (Fundação Paraguaçu). Fundação Paraguaçu will work with poor families in basin of the Paraguaçu River on the restoration and responsible use of the Caatinga biome whose woodlands have become degraded. It will plant gardens, create a community seed bank, cultivate seedlings and providing training in reforestation and the production of traditional handicrafts from the resources available. 500 residents of the Chapada Diamantina region of Bahia will benefit directly and another 5,000 indirectly.. Centro de Agricultura Alternativa do Norte de Minas (CAANM) will assist smallholder farmers and indigenous communities to improve agroecological production, processing and marketing of fruits and sugarcane in the semi-arid region of Northern Minas Gerais.. Centro de Agricultura Alternativa do Norte de Minas (CAANM) will assist smallholder farmers and indigenous communities to improve agroecological production, processing and marketing of fruits and sugarcane in the semi-arid region of Northern Minas Gerais. Project activities also include the development of a participatory certification system and the opening of new markets for agroecological products in the region. The project will benefit about 240 families directly and 1,000 other families indirectly..

participating-org.narrative: Centro de Agricultura Alternativa do Norte de Minas

mailing-address.narrative: 1331 Pennsylvania Ave. NW, Suite 1200 NorthÂ Washington, DC 20004

description.narrative: U.S. assistance to Brazil will continue to deepen partnerships with the Government of Brazil (GOB) to make progress on shared goals, including improving regional stability by enhancing security and law-enforcement cooperation. The United States will continue to assist in the deployment of new technologies and methods in the Ministry of Health to create an AIDS-free generation. Brazilian military officials will continue to receive training that fosters closer cooperation and the ability to implement shared strategies. Brazilian and U.S. security will be enhanced by combating transnational crime, improving the rule of law, and strengthening counterterrorism programs. Under the U.S.-Brazil Joint Initiative on Climate Change signed in 2015 and the USAID-GOB Development Objective Agreement on Biodiversity Conservation signed in 2014, the United States and Brazil are pursuing cooperation on environmental priorities, including biodiversity conservation and climate change mitigation and adaptation.
Disbursement of funds to the Award Implementing Organization to carry out the activities set forth in Annex A of the grant agreement.
